alert.note: Alert for Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 8:02AM CST until February 28 at 1:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Turkey River at Elkader affecting Clayton County. .Heavy rain has fallen on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows are high and have reached critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Turkey River at Elkader. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs in areas near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM CST Tuesday was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 7.2 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.4 feet on 08/24/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 900 PM CST.
